publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5694 Frances Curran: Save Ferguson’s Shipyard—That the Parliament notes that 99 workers at Ferguson’s in Port Glasgow face imminent redundancy unless a new order for work is found and urges the Scottish Executive to meet the workers’ trade unions in order to reach agreement that an order for a fisheries protection vessel be urgently placed with the yard, thus safeguarding these vital skilled jobs.
S2M-5694 Save Ferguson’s Shipyard (lodged on 5 March 2007) Rosie Kane*, Colin Fox*, Tommy Sheridan*, Carolyn Leckie*, John Swinburne*
S2M-5694 Save Ferguson’s Shipyard (lodged on 5 March 2007) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Dr Jean Turner*

S2M-5694 Frances Curran: Save Ferguson’s Shipyard—That the Parliament notes that 99 workers at Ferguson’s in Port Glasgow face imminent redundancy unless a new order for work is found and urges the Scottish Executive to meet the workers’ trade unions in order to reach agreement that an order for a fisheries protection vessel be urgently placed with the yard, thus safeguarding these vital skilled jobs. Supported by: Rosie Kane, Colin Fox, Tommy Sheridan, Carolyn Leckie, John Swinburne, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Dr Jean Turner
